intro: Zornia pratensis subsp. pratensis, commonly known as meadow zornia, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches a height of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features trifoliate leaves with three oval to ovate leaflets and produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink to violet. It is often found in moist meadows, wetlands, and along streambanks, where it thrives in well-drained to moderately wet soils. This species is valued for its ecological role in nitrogen fixation and as a food source for various insects and wildlife.
